snippet: Steven P. Jobs pushed Apple's software designers to use virtual doodads that mimic the appearance and behavior of real-world things, like wooden shelves for organizing newspapers. But the company's management shake-up is likely to mean that Apple...
abstract: Steven P. Jobs pushed Apple's software designers to use virtual doodads that mimic the appearance and behavior of real-world things, like wooden shelves for organizing newspapers. But the company's management shake-up is likely to mean that Apple will shift away from such tricks, Nick Wingfield and Nick Bilton report in Thursday's New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Apple Shake-Up May Lead to Design Shift
